newsitem.title: DUBAI: Dubai firm awards condensate refinery contract.
newsitem.headline: Dubai firm awards condensate refinery contract.

text.p: Emirates National Oil Company (ENOC) has awarded Italy's Technipetrol a $200 million contract to build a 60,000 barrels per day (bpd) capacity condensate refinery in Dubai, the UAE news agency WAM reported on Tuesday.
The plant, at Dubai's Jebel Ali free trade zone, would be completed in the first quarter of 1999, the agency said.
The refinery, which is planned to be eventually expanded to 100,000 bpd, will process condensate mainly for sale in UAE and Gulf markets, according to industry sources.
ENOC is wholly owned by the government of Dubai, one of the seven emirates that make up OPEC-member UAE.
